strapiArticle.title: Sinangag at Tuyo
strapiArticle.description: Garlic Fried Rice and Dried Fish

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 4 cups cooked rice (preferably day-old rice)
  • 4-6 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • Salt, to taste
  • Dried fish (Tuyo), as desired
  • Vinegar (optional, for dipping the dried fish)

Instructions:

  1. Heat the cooking oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.

  2. Add the minced garlic to the pan and saut√© until it turns golden brown and fragrant, being careful not to burn it.

  3. Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir-fry it with the garlic, breaking up any clumps and ensuring that the garlic is evenly distributed.

  4. Continue stirring and frying the rice for about 5-7 minutes, or until it becomes slightly toasted and heated through.

  5. Season the sinangag (garlic fried rice) with salt to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference. Mix well to ensure that the salt is evenly distributed.

  6. In a separate pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the dried fish (Tuyo) to the pan and fry it on both sides until it becomes crispy and golden brown. The cooking time may vary depending on the size and thickness of the dried fish.

  7. Once the sinangag and dried fish are cooked, transfer them to a serving plate.

  8. Serve the Sinangag at Tuyo together, with the garlic fried rice as the base and the crispy dried fish on top.

  9. Optional: You can serve the dried fish with a side of vinegar for dipping. Vinegar provides a tangy flavor that complements the saltiness of the dried fish.

Sinangag at Tuyo is a classic Filipino breakfast combination that offers a delightful mix of flavors and textures. The fragrant garlic fried rice pairs perfectly with the crispy and savory dried fish. Enjoy this delicious and satisfying meal to start your day!
